team19.weatherapp

Class ShortTermForecast

  • java.lang.Object
    • team19.weatherapp.ShortTermForecast

  • public class ShortTermForecast
extends java.lang.Object
    The ShortTermForecast class holds all of the long term weather data for the specified city. When the json is parsed, it is passed into the ShortTermForecast constructor, which retrieves the data from the JSONObject and saves it into multiple variables. Once saved, a user can easy access any of these variables by referencing them through the city object.
    Author:
    Scott Mackie

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShortTermForecast

        public ShortTermForecast(org.json.JSONObject j,
                         char tempUnits)
                  throws org.json.JSONException
        The ShortTermForecast constructor retrieves the JSONObject data, and saves the data into variable fields. The data is saved in the format specified by tempUnits and windUnits.
        Parameters:
        j - This is the JSONObject that the city data is retrieved from
        tempUnits - The temperature units shows which units the temperature data should be stored in
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - Throws a JSONExcpetion, required for JSONObjects

        public java.lang.String getFullCityName(org.json.JSONObject j)
                                 throws org.json.JSONException
        This is a getter method for the name of the city. It takes a JSONObject, and returns the name of the city that is located within that JSON Object.
        Parameters:
        j - The JSONObject that contains the City Name
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the city in String Format
        Throws:

      • getSkyIcon

        public javax.swing.ImageIcon getSkyIcon(org.json.JSONObject j)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        org.json.JSONException
        This is a getter method for the Sky Icon of the city. It takes a JSONObject, and returns the Sky Icon of the city that is located within that JSON Object. It does this by retrieving the specified file name (located within the JSON Object), then returns the icon that matches this file name
        Parameters:
        j - The JSONObject that contains the city Sky Icon
        Returns:
        Returns the Sky Icon of the city in ImageIcon Format
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the image cannot be found, throws an error
        org.json.JSONException - Throws a JSONExcpetion, required for JSONObjects

      • getTime

        public java.lang.String getTime(org.json.JSONArray j,
                                int index)
                         throws org.json.JSONException
        This is a getter method for the time of the forecast. It takes a JSONArray and an index, and returns the time of the forecast that is located at that index within the JSONArray.
        Parameters:
        j - The JSONArray that contains the forecast data
        index - The index of the forecast within the JSONArray
        Returns:
        Returns the time of the given forecast in String Format
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - Throws a JSONExcpetion, required for JSONObjects
